com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor

Class RepositoryAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.RepositoryAccessor

  • public class RepositoryAccessor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a wrapper for the file operations provided by Java. This is done to abstract away the work done to access files. This class is used to access a repository. It allows the user to read and write contents from files in the repository. Al operations are done relative to the basePath of the instance.

    The user is freed from the work of resource handling as it is taken care by the implementation itself.

    Author:
    Kaartic Sivaraam

    • Constructor Detail

      • RepositoryAccessor

        public RepositoryAccessor(java.lang.String basePath)
                   throws com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.InvalidRepositoryOperation
        Parameters:
        base - The base path of the repository (directory) relative to which all methods (unless otherwise noted) perform their operations.
        Throws:
        com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.InvalidRepositoryOperation - The constructor throws when the given base path does not exist.

    • Method Detail

      • readFromFile

        public java.lang.StringBuilder readFromFile(java.lang.String source)
                                     throws com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.InvalidRepositoryOperation
        This method reads contents from the source and returns the contents as a StringBuilder .
        Parameters:
        source - It is the path of the source file relative to the basePath
        Returns:
        The contents of the file are returned as a StringBuilder .
        Throws:
        com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.InvalidRepositoryOperation - This method throws this class when,
        • the file does not exist
        • an IOException occurs during a file operation

      • writeToNewFile

        public void writeToNewFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                           java.lang.String contentsToWrite)
                    throws com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.InvalidRepositoryOperation
        This method writes the contents of the provided String , to the a file with the provided fileName which is, assumed to not exist before invocation.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of file which is to be created. The file would be created in the base path.
        contentsToWrite - The String containing the contents to be written to the file.
        Throws:
        com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.InvalidRepositoryOperation - This method throws when,
        • the Parent of the file doesn't exist
        • file does exists previously
        • an IOException occurs during File write operation

      • appendToFile

        public void appendToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                         java.lang.String contentsToWrite)
                  throws com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.InvalidRepositoryOperation
        This method writes the contents of the provided String , to the destination which is assumed to, exist before invocation.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to which contents would be appended. The file must exist before trying to append to it.
        contentsToWrite - The String containing the contents to be written to the file.
        Throws:
        com.asgoc.common.code.repositoryAccessor.InvalidRepositoryOperation - This method throws when,
        • the Parent of the file doesn't exist
        • the file does not exist
        • an IOException occurs during File write operation
